isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - LUBRICATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: Transmissions are designed so that the internal parts operate in a bath of oil circulated by the motion of gears and shafts.
Thus, all parts will be amply lubricated if these procedures are closely followed:

item.para: Use the correct grade and type of oil. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The use of mild EP gear oil or multi-purpose gear oil is not recommended, but if these gear oils are used, be sure to adhere to the following limitations:

Do not use mild EP gear oil or multi-purpose gear oil when operating temperatures are above 230 degrees F (110 degrees C). Many of these gear oils, particularly 85W140, break down above 230 degrees F and coat seals, bearings and gears with deposits that may cause premature failures. If these deposits are observed (especially a coating on seal areas causing oil leakage), change to Eaton Roadranger CD50 transmission fluid, heavy duty engine oil or mineral gear oil to assure maximum component life and to maintain your warranty with Eaton.

In addition, transmission oil coolers are not recommended with these gear oils since the oil cooler materials may be attacked by these gear oils. The lower temperature limit and oil cooler restriction with these gear oils generally limit their success to milder applications.
Additives and friction modifiers are not recommended for use in Eaton Fuller transmissions.

svcproc.title: PROPER OIL LEVEL
svcproc.para: Make sure oil is level with filler opening. Because you can reach oil with your finger does not mean oil is at proper level. One inch of oil level is about one gallon of oil.

para.title: Proper Lubrication Levels as Related to Transmission Installation Angles

svcproc.para: If the transmission operating angle is more than 12 degrees, improper lubrication can occur. The operating angle is the transmission mounting angle in the chassis plus percent of upgrade (expressed in degrees).
Anytime the transmission operating angle of 12 degrees is exceeded for an extended period of time, the transmission should be equipped with an oil pump or cooler kit to insure proper lubrication.
